instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Hello,

I have an 820-3476 that initially had short on ppvcc_s0_CPU. removed the damaged cap C1008 near the cpu without heat.
no more shorts but still does not boot.
i detected pulsing voltage when plugin in magsafe from s4 all the way to all_sys_pwgd. no other shorts found so far.
any suggestions on troubleshooting steps to continue ?

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Post actual resistance to ground at L7310/20.
Any history fault, liquid signs?

Stable 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
resistace to gnd on L7310/20 is 42ohms

only liquid signs on c1801(removed) and Q1840(replaced)

and yes stable 3v3_s5/SUS.

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Do you note any pulse at PPVCC_S0_CPU too?
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
There is a pulse there and at VCORE as well..
same dead on SMC bypass

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Any pulse at PLT_RST_L?
If not check pin 3 of U1950 too.

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
can't find PLT_RST_L, hopefully PLT_RST_BUF_L is the same.. and no pulse here
and nothing on pin 3 of u1950 either

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
***you can ignore this***
i'm measuring pp3v3_S0 @ 1.9V. is this right? i'm not even getting p3v3s0_EN always on how is there even voltage here @@?

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Yeah, is PLT_RESET_L in fact.

Check for pulse at pins 7, 5, 6, 3 of U1950.
Inspect its area for corrosion.

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: no corrosion in the area, no pulse on pin 3,6. pulses on pin 5,7 on u1950

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: Tie together pins 5 & 6, then check pin 3.

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: now i get a pulse on pin 3, still not turning on. whats next?

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
PLT_RESET_L pulses now?
Try SMC bypass again.

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: Yes  PLT_RESET_L  pulses now but still no boot, Fan does not even attempt to spin with SMC bypass

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Termination resistors and traces.
Clean J6100; remove, if needed.

You should have something more corroded.
Also possible to have accumulated crap underneath SMC, or CPU.

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
all SPI termination resisters and traces are in order.. no other corrosion seen from the original c1801(removed) and Q1840(replaced).

J6100 is removed and SMC already reballed. which only left CPU. dead CPU or just reflow?

threads.title: 820-3476 pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: Try heating CPU with quality flux; just to burn eventually accumulated crap.
